Hi guys, is there a way of checking if any of the fields within an item group(dropdown in this case) have been populated so I can set a flag

Hi everyone! General question for you. How do you generally set up your GTM and GA tracking codes? Do you use the HubSpot integration and block your analytics from working without cookie opt-in, or do you install it manually and set up specific GA settings that protect user privacy?

We’re having a professional debate at our agency about our best practice should be, and I’m curious what other people do while maintaining GDPR compliance.
<@U02BS7SRUHL> - do you get an answer for this? I am trying to figure out the same thing!

Hey all - Working on some webpack/hubpsot plugins right now. Im building a postcss plugin that will allow you to write hubl/will compile down into hubl during the build process. I currently have it working for css declarations But I am running into some errors when trying to get if statements and for loops to work.

I quickly bundled it up into a npm package. And have it public on git. Feel free to take a look and help out if any of you are webpack/postCSS savy! Im def not so in the know on these tools but am trying my best to hack my way into them. :slightly_smiling_face:

<https://www.npmjs.com/package/@jazzyclimber/postcss-hubl-ignore>
might be a good idea to post this in <#CLJJXGTC0|local-development> and <#CCQ7H31D5|developer-tools> to get some :eyes:
We have a dynamic product page that we pull data from HubDB. Is it possible to make a dynamic page template with Drag end drop areas so we can add content based on a particular product?
